text: Alexander "Alex" Asberry (November 2, 1861 - abt. 1903) was a grocer and Republican politician who served one term in the Texas Legislature. He was born in Wilderville, Texas in 1861, the son of William and Julia Asberry. He was educated at Hearne Academy and worked in the grocery business. He unsuccessfully ran for the legislature in 1884, but was elected in 1888. He was a delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1888 and 1892. He ran again for the legislature in 1892, but was defeated. He again ran for the legislature in 1896, and was narrowly defeated in a contested election. He also served as a deacon in his church. He died about 1903. ==References== :Texas Legislators: Past & Present - Alexander Asberry :Handbook of Texas Online - Alexander Asberry :Forever Free: Nineteenth Century African-American Legislators and Constitutional Convention Delegates of Texas Category:Members of the Texas House of Representatives Category:Texas Republicans Category:1861 births Category:1903 deaths Category:African-American state legislators in Texas Category:African-American politicians during the Reconstruction Era Category:People from Falls County, Texas Category:Grocers Category:People from Robertson County, Texas
title: Alexander Asberry
